greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n - A048735(n) = n - (n AND floor(n/2)).
comment: In binary expansion of n, change those 1's to 0's that have an 1-bit next to them at their left (more significant) side. Only fibbinary numbers (A003714) occur as terms.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..16383
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: a(n) = n - A048735(n) = n - (n AND floor(n/2)) = n XOR (n AND floor(n/2)), where AND is bitwise-AND (A004198) and XOR is bitwise-XOR (A003987).
example: a(n) = 1060 = binary 10000100100   high 1 of each run
mathematica: Table[n - BitAnd[n, Floor[n/2]], {n, 0, 93}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 17 2017 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 16 2017
